subject: Re: [junit] Generating reports from command line
msgSnippet: ... Ant generates that report with XSLT. The XSL stylesheets Ant uses are included in the ant-junit.jar, so you could apply that stylesheet yourself. To get
messageBody:
Yogesh wrote:

> I am running junit tests through a java program. is there a way to
> generate reports also using a java program identical to the reports
> generated via ant tool?

Ant generates that report with XSLT.

The XSL stylesheets Ant uses are included in the ant-junit.jar, so you
could apply that stylesheet yourself.

To get the Ant task's XML output, though, I'm not sure. I suppose you
could just invoke the Ant junit task through Java, although I have no
idea how much environment setup Ant provides and how easy that is. I've
never tried it.

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
